abstract: British prosecutors drop charges against nine of 12 tabloid journalists who faced trial for investigative practices, including Andy Coulson, former News of the World editor and media adviser to Prime Min David Cameron.
lead_paragraph: Those who will be spared prosecution over allegations that they paid officials for information include Andy Coulson, a former editor of The News of the World.

headline.main: British Prosecutors Drop Charges Against 9 Journalists in Tabloid Inquiry
headline.print_headline: British Prosecutors Drop Charges Against 9 Journalists in Tabloid Inquiry

snippet: Those who will be spared prosecution over allegations that they paid officials for information include Andy Coulson, a former editor of The News of the World.

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
